duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage all restricted grants and projects by leading the budgeting, forecasting, tracking, and reporting efforts.
Work collaboratively with the Grants Manager and other Department Managers to build actionable budgets and forecasts.
Track revenue and spend to measure progress against budgets and produce reports for various stakeholders.
Ensure the allocation of expenses against grant budgets in compliance with grant terms and maintain reports in the organization's accounting system.
Prepare financial reports and budget modifications with Conservancy Managers and Finance Director.
Perform accounting and financial functions, including preparing monthly reports and budget and expense analysis.
Monitor grant-related financial activities and journal entries, including revenue and indirect expense allocations.
Allocate direct and indirect expenses to various grants in the accounting system and assist with grant closeout procedures.
Enhance the process to perform monthly journal entries to allocate costs across expense accounts and be the go-to person for questions regarding the organization’s budgets and grants.
Provide budgets and grant-related financial analysis as needed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) in accounting, finance, business, or equivalent from a four-year college or technical school; or five years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge of accounting principles is required.
